Reason: The configuration option _clock is performance-sensitive. The reason for this classification is that the clock() method is directly related to time-related operations in the application. The method checks the _clock variable and returns a Clock object accordingly, which can have a significant impact on performance depending on the Clock implementation chosen. If the _clock variable is not null, it returns _clock, which means the choice of Clock implementation directly affects the performance of time-related operations in the system. Therefore, any changes or optimizations in the configuration of _clock can lead to notable performance variations at the system level.
